content.description: Establish yourself deep in the pit on wide, juggy underclings with a solid kneebar. Use your knees and compression to reach out to the big right arete. Slap up the arete, working into a good left hand crimp before riding the rail to the finish.
content.location:
It in the pit just slightly downriver and downhill from

Into the Light

.

content.description: Sit start deep in the pit. Begin with a left hand sidepulling crimp, a right hand low juggy wide pinch, and your feet on small chips. Lunge up and left to the arete, then go right to a sloper with an incut. Work your feet around right using toes and heels on the mantel. There are good holds on top to finish.
content.protection: A thin pad to avoid dabbing.
content.location:
This is deep in the pit, slightly downriver and downhill of

Into the Light

.

content.description: This is on the highball west face. If you fall, the jagged boulders will catch you.
content.location: It is on the west face.

content.description: This is on one of the best boulders of its grade in the canyon. Hidden around the corner from the Catslab, this roof boulder climbs with some thuggery and has an exciting finish.
content.location: It is hidden downstream from Catslab on the north side of the river.

content.description: SDS as far left as you can go on a really good sidepull.  Bump up the rail to a decent ledge, get the feet up, and throw big with your left hand.  Match and then top out to the right to gain a few more fun moves.
content.protection: At least two pads would be recommended.  The landing is pretty rugged.  A spotter is good for the big crux move.  There is a pretty sketchy pit below and to the left.
content.location: This is on the large split boulder that sits directly below the Cat Slab.  It climbs the south-ish side of the boulder that you do not see on the approach.

content.description:
This line is a variation of

Into the Light

.

Start as for

Into the Light

, but instead of using the upper crimps through the middle section, stay low, work your way through some small holds, avoiding dabbing on the big boulder as you rejoin

Into the Light

, and finish via the big jugs on the far right end of the boulder.

Since a lot of the routes on this boulder have been re-FA'ed due to a lack of info, I thought I would chime in. I went to this boulder back in 2005-8 with Skyer Weekes. He did this line as well as most of the other moderates, that's not to say no one climbed those them before him (no info was available). With that said, I think this right-trending traverse is his work and a ultra-classic. It is pumpy fun and a techincial climb that ain't over 'til it's over.
content.location: Start as far left as you can, finish far right at the top of the boulder. Get a good spot as it gets a bit spicy.

content.description: Hello Kitty follows the tall arete. It starts on a low rail and follows slopers and crimps to a very small crimp move just before the lip.
content.location: The problem is located on the uphill arete of the lower of the two huge boulders just below the Cat Slab.

climbs.name: Light at the End of the Tunnel

content.description:
Start at the left end and link into “

Into The Light

”. This is an obvious extension that adds some fun moves and pump. Your left hand starts on a sloper and your right hand on the arete hand wrap 6 inches from your left hand?
content.location:
Start low and left of

Into The Light

.

content.description: Start matched on the right sidepull. Span your left hand to a sidepull crimp feature, and work your feet up. Latch a small crimp with your right hand working small feet, and launch for the ledge feature overhead. Gliding onto the ledge correctly will determine if you send or not.
content.protection: At least one pad. Two are ideal.
content.location: It is down near the river facing East.

content.description:
Diamondback is a classic technical CCC testpiece. Located on a tall arete with perfect rock, this is definitely one of Clear Creek’s better boulder problems. SDS on a low crimp/sidepull cluster. Make some beta-intensive moves up the arete to a final crux on bad slopers and worse feet. Stab to a good edge, and top out. This aesthetic line is a perfect cold weather project along with the nearby testpiece

Halfway Crooks

.
content.protection: A good amount of pads. That landing is OK.
content.location:
This ascends the biggest, coolest arete on the main boulder under Catslab. Hike as for Catslab, and the large boulder should be clear. This boulder also hosts the classic moderate

Into The Light

.

content.description:
Located to the right of

Sex Panther

, this problem begins on two small crimps just to the left of a large boulder (be sure not to dab!). The problem then climbs up and to the right. Hug the side pulling flake to a perfectly cut crimp slot. Then throw directly up to a white open handed jug (be sure to climb straight up and not out to the right).
content.protection: A couple of pads would help. This problem is intimidating and has a bad landing.
content.location:
It is located to the right of

Sex Panther

. This problem is on the larger boulder facing the Catslab Crag.

content.description: Start on a large, incut jug, and follow a sloping rail up and right to a jug topout.
content.location: It is located basically on the river and 100 yards down river from the Catslab.
